quest.name: How to Catch an Automaton
journal: The decisive dwarf regards you with the steely determination of someone who's about to ask a favor.
objectives: Use the hempen sack to capture a weakened dwarven automaton.
Deliver the dwarven automaton to the decisive dwarf.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: To be deleted.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: To be deleted.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: Oh, it's you. I've been meaning to apologize─for my behavior at the meeting.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: For all my bluster, I had nothing to offer. You made me see the hypocrite that I was, and I'm determined to do better.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: I'd be lying if I said I wasn't struggling, though...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: We need more automata to help us rebuild, you see, and I thought that we could repurpose the ones we've got guarding the village.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: But when I went to shut one down, the blasted thing tried to bash my head in. Barely escaped with my beard, I tell you. Whoever programmed them did their job a little too well...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: You're supposed to be a mighty warrior, though, ain't that right? Think you could subdue an ironbeard for me, just to show how it's done? If I could see it once, I reckon I could deal with them by myself.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Just watch and learn.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Oh, all right...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: I'm in your debt. Here, take this sack. You can slip it over an ironbeard to keep it subdued after you've knocked it around enough.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: How fares the peddling? Extremely well! The Eulmorans can't get enough of our rare and wondrous wares.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: In spite of myself, I have to say that things are coming along nicely. Who would've thought that we could achieve so much by working together instead of bickering?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: In case you weren't sure, the ironbeards patrol the area just west of the village. I'll be watching─from a safe distance.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: Bugger my beard, you took care of the automaton so quickly, I would've missed it if I'd blinked!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: Thanks for bringing this thing back, and for the lesson as well. I reckon I've got the trick of it now.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: I've also come to realize something: there ain't no action so noble as one that you take for another.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: I'll keep that close to my heart, and strive to be someone who strives for others, just like you.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: By the way, the chief came looking for you while you were outside the village. It seemed important, so go and see what he wants, eh?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: Have you gone to see the chief yet? It seemed important, so go and see what he wants, eh?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: To be deleted.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: To be deleted.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: To be deleted.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: Ah, it's you again. Thanks to you, we've now got a good lot of automata helping us out, but we could still do with more.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: If you're not too busy, do you think you could retrieve another ironbeard for us? Rest assured you won't be doing it alone this time─I'm going to retrieve one too.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: When we're done, let's meet back here. Happy deactivating!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: There're still some among us who don't understand the work we're doing. But like you won us over, we can win them over too.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: Sometimes, someone will come over and tell me off. “The hells you thinking, playing around with bits of those machines? It's downright creepy!” they'd say.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: I don't let it discourage me, though. This is what I've chosen to do, and I'm going to keep doing it, rain, hail, or doom.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: Ugh, of all the times to get a cramp... You go on ahead─I'll be on my way as soon as I can... <grunt>

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: Whew... It was rough going even with your example, but I managed to shut down an automaton in the end. How about you?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: Great! With these two additional units on duty, I'll be able to spend more time drink─

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: Er...I mean, I'll be able to spend more time doing...things. That automata can't do. For the rebuilding. Yes, yes, that's it!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: ...Ahem. Thanks to you, I've found something that I can do for Komra. But as helpful as you are, it wouldn't do to rely on you forever. No, from this point on, I want to make sure I can get by on my own when the time comes.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: There might be others who could use a hand, though, so you ought to talk to the chief. Thanks again, and be seeing you!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: To be deleted.
